description.narrative: The Program is to expand access to early childhood education, and to improve student assessment and teaching and learning conditions for Jordanian children and Syrian refugee children.

title.narrative: Number of Syrian refugee boys and girls benefitting from the PforR Program interventions, disaggregated by gender and level of education
Upper secondary teachers trained in the administration of the digital, competency-based tawjihi exam
Number of additional public and PPP KG2 classrooms added and operational
Publication of semi-annual reports utilizing digitized school-level socioemotional well-being data
Number of teachers meeting minimum standards of socioemotional skills development, disaggregated by gender
Number of teachers evaluated against the new National Teacher Professional Standards (NTPS) who meet the minimum performance standards
Number of additional schools with upgraded health, hygiene and safety facilities to meet minimum national standards
Strategy for mainstreaming blended learning developed, covering equity considerations for marginal communities
KG2 television content developed and broadcast building on MOE 2020 Emergency Response Plan
National KG2 Quality Assurance System developed
Blended learning content and assessment tools developed in alignment with MOE strategy
Teacher evaluation framework officially adopted and nationally disseminated
Action plan developed to reform the relative weight afforded to tawjihi to determine graduation and admission to higher education
Legal regulation adopted towards reforming the dual purpose of the tawjihi high-stakes exam
Geographical Information System (GIS) and Open EMIS produce accurate and timely disaggregated data needed for program monitoring
Grade 3 diagnostic test on early grade reading and math implemented
Number of public and private classrooms meeting minimum KG2 quality standards
Students benefiting from direct interventions to enhance learning
Number of Jordanian children and Syrian refugee children enrolled in KG2, disaggregated by nationality, gender, and type of school
Percentage of grievances received through the grievance redress mechanism that are resolved within 21 days
Percentage of teachers satisfaction with the quality of engagement on: i)mainstreaming of blended learning activities; (ii) the reform towards a digitized, competency-based tawjihi exam (Percentage)
Competency-based digital tawjihi exam designed and tested in at least 5 cities
Student satisfaction survey conducted gauging the quality of engagement on the creation of the digitized, competency-based tawjihi exam
Percentage point reduction in secondary net enrolment rate gender gap, disaggregated by nationality
Students benefiting from direct interventions to enhance learning - Female
